supporting_text: The NAP strengthens Ireland's commitment to the international One Health approach for AMR and provides an ambitious framework for action to 2025 to drive change for citizens.
The NAP outlines specific actions in the human health sector, including improving awareness and knowledge of AMR.
The NAP includes actions aimed at optimising the use of antibiotics in animal health and promoting research and sustainable investment in new medicines.
The NAP recognizes the role of the environment in the emergence and spread of resistance and includes actions to enhance understanding and management of AMR in the environment.
The NAP includes actions related to the agricultural sector, focusing on the prudent use of antimicrobials and improving animal health.
The NAP outlines the establishment of a single webpage for AMR policy and the development of a One Health Surveillance Report on an annual basis.
The NAP includes specific actions with timelines for delivery across various strategic objectives.
The document does not specify quantitative targets for AMR prevalence and antimicrobial use.
The NAP mentions substantial targeted funding provided to the HSE to support the implementation of AMR actions.
The document does not contain a specific assessment of future budget requirements for activities.
The NAP mentions the National Interdepartmental AMR Consultative Committee as the intersectoral coordinating mechanism.
The NAP includes actions related to the development of a National Secure Veterinary Prescription System to regulate antimicrobial use.
The NAP includes actions to promote learning on AMR and IPC for schools and educational institutions.
The NAP outlines the use of European Antibiotic Awareness Day and World Antimicrobial Awareness Week to promote public awareness.
The NAP emphasizes collaboration with international stakeholders and organizations to address AMR.
The NAP includes actions to enhance surveillance of antibiotic resistance and antibiotic use.
The NAP includes actions to improve surveillance and reporting of AMR.
The NAP emphasizes the importance of infection prevention and control measures.
The NAP aligns with international standards and guidelines for AMR control.
The NAP includes actions related to the regulation of antibiotic use in veterinary medicine.
The NAP includes a policy document on the restricted use of Highest Priority Critically Important Antimicrobials.
The NAP promotes research collaborations at EU and global levels to address AMR.
